Class TestPersistenceService

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.eclipse.smarthome.model.persistence.tests.TestPersistenceService
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    PersistenceService, QueryablePersistenceService

    public class TestPersistenceService
extends Object
implements QueryablePersistenceService
    A simple persistence service used for unit tests
    Author:
    Kai Kreuzer - Initial contribution and API

      String getId()
      Returns the id of this PersistenceService.
      Set<PersistenceItemInfo> getItemInfo()
      Returns a list of items that are stored in the persistence service This is returned as a string to allow the persistence service to return items that are no long available as an ESH Item.

      Returns the label of this PersistenceService.

    • Method Detail

      • getId

        public String getId()
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceService
        Returns the id of this PersistenceService. This id is used to uniquely identify the PersistenceService.
        Specified by:
        getId in interface PersistenceService
        Returns:
        the id to uniquely identify the PersistenceService.

      • store

        public void store(Item item)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceService
        Stores the current value of the given item.

        Implementors should keep in mind that all registered PersistenceServices are called synchronously. Hence long running operations should be processed asynchronously. E.g. store adds things to a queue which is processed by some asynchronous workers (Quartz Job, Thread, etc.).

        Specified by:
        store in interface PersistenceService
        Parameters:
        item - the item which state should be persisted.

      • store

        public void store(Item item,
                  String alias)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceService

        Stores the current value of the given item under a specified alias.

        Implementors should keep in mind that all registered PersistenceServices are called synchronously. Hence long running operations should be processed asynchronously. E.g. store adds things to a queue which is processed by some asynchronous workers (Quartz Job, Thread, etc.).

        Specified by:
        store in interface PersistenceService
        Parameters:
        item - the item which state should be persisted.
        alias - the alias under which the item should be persisted.

      • query

        public Iterable<HistoricItem> query(FilterCriteria filter)
        Description copied from interface: QueryablePersistenceService
        Queries the PersistenceService for data with a given filter criteria
        Specified by:
        query in interface QueryablePersistenceService
        Parameters:
        filter - the filter to apply to the query
        Returns:
        a time series of items

      • getItemInfo

        public Set<PersistenceItemInfo> getItemInfo()
        Description copied from interface: QueryablePersistenceService
        Returns a list of items that are stored in the persistence service This is returned as a string to allow the persistence service to return items that are no long available as an ESH Item.
        Specified by:
        getItemInfo in interface QueryablePersistenceService
        Returns:
        list of strings of item names contained in the store. Not null.

      • getLabel

        public String getLabel(Locale locale)
        Description copied from interface: PersistenceService
        Returns the label of this PersistenceService. This label provides a user friendly name for the PersistenceService.
        Specified by:
        getLabel in interface PersistenceService
        Parameters:
        locale - the language to return the label in, or null for the default language
        Returns:
        the label of the PersistenceService.
